channel.title: Predictable ping spikes
channel.description:
I've been having absurdly predictable ping spikes and I can't figure out why
I have some ping tests showing how it seems to be 'scheduled'. On the left is the NA league server, on the right is google.com. Blank lines are dropped packets. http://i.gyazo.com/8c8bda2e6f690c8427421884f96cc8f5.gif http://i.gyazo.com/68160d8b7540a56876534337a979491b.gif
If you want to see a longer log I'd be happy to make one.
Anyway, it seems to happen every 8 or so pings (8 seconds). Without fail. I have absolutely no idea why, there was nothing else on the network and I had no other programs running on my computer (other than what was used to record, but this happens when I'm not recording).
I thought the internet was bad because of the weather (we have like a foot of snow), but it seems far too predictable to be any sort of coincidence.
Do you guys have any tips? Need any more information? (Router/modem is docsis 3.0, have comcast... also their customer service line is down right now which is A++++)

item.title: Predictable ping spikes
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

Do you have the Comcast supplied router modem combo unit? If so, replace it with a personal router and modem. You’re paying $10 a month for really bad hardware.

Read full topic

item.title: Predictable ping spikes
item.dc:creator: @Spades Spades
item.description:
@Spades wrote:

Only time weather really should be a factor is if you are using satellite internet. Try rebooting both Modem and Router. Leave them off for 30+ seconds and then turn them back on and see if the problem continues. If it is, call your ISP and find out what is going on.

Read full topic
